shapes

Class OrientedPolygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.Shape
      • shapes.ArbitrarySimplePolygon
        • shapes.OrientedPolygon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable, Rotateable, Translateable, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Trapezoid, Triangle

    public abstract class OrientedPolygon
extends ArbitrarySimplePolygon
    An abstract class to represent any polygon with a base and height, i.e. an orientation. A subclass of OrientedPolygon should be some polygon which has use for storage of base and height, such as use in area formulas.

    An OrientedPolygon can be created with a rotated Point list, as base and height should only be used for rotation invariant calculations such as area. As long as base and height are valid for some other rotation of the given polygon, the polygon is valid.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      static class  OrientedPolygon.AngleBuilder
      An abstract class which adds a bottom left (with rotation of 0) angle argument to HeightBuilder.
      static class  OrientedPolygon.BaseBuilder
      An abstract class which adds a base length argument to RotationBuilder.
      static class  OrientedPolygon.HeightBuilder
      An abstract class which adds a height argument to BaseBuilder.
      static class  OrientedPolygon.OffsetBuilder
      An abstract class which adds a top edge offset from the base argument to HeightBuilder.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OrientedPolygon

        protected OrientedPolygon(int x,
                          int y,
                          java.awt.Color color,
                          java.awt.Point[] points,
                          int rotation,
                          int base,
                          int height)
        Constructs a new OrientedPolygon with the given coodinates, color, Point array, rotation, base, and height. All Points are copied and translated so that the given coordinates equal the top left corner of the bounding box for the polygon specified in the Point array with the specified rotation. The first and last Points are to be joined by a line segment, in addition to all consecutive elements.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of this OrientedPolygon.
        y - The y coordinate of this OrientedPolygon.
        color - The Color to draw this OrientedPolygon with.
        points - The Points which specify a path that forms a simple polygon.
        rotation - The amount, in degrees, this polygon is rotated from its intial orientation. A positive value results in an anticlockwise rotation.
        base - The length of this OrientedPolygon's base.
        height - The height of this OrientedPolygon.

    • Method Detail

      • getBase

        public int getBase()
        Gets the length of this OrientedPolygon's base. The base is the single straight horizontal edge which lies exactly on the bottom edge of the bounding box of this shape, i.e. the lowest y coordinate for some rotation of the polygon.

        No guarantees are made that the Point list has an edge which corresponds to this attribute.

        Returns:
        int, the length of this OrientedPolygon's base.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        The height of this OrientedPolygon. The height is the length of the longest possible straight line segment perpendicular to the base, between the base and another point within the polygon.

        No guarantees are made that the Point list has a height which corresponds to this attribute.

        Returns:
        int, the height of this OrientedPolygon.
